newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICAN ARMATO BUYS SWEETMAKER, IMPORTER.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICAN ARMATO BUYS SWEETMAKER, IMPORTER.

text.p: South African snack and sweet maker Armato Food Industries said on Thursday it had spent 219 million rand ($47.5 million) to buy a rival confectioner and an importer.
It said the move would boost current earnings per share on a pro forma basis by 21.5 percent to 32.2 South African cents.
"Armato has bought Pepe Confectioners and its subsidiary National Candy Industries (NCI) for 160 million rand and the Alpine Importers group for 59 million rand," it said in a statement.

"In addition to the positive impact which the acquisitions will have on our earnings in the current and future financial years, the potential for vertical integration of all three businesses will add an exciting new dimension to our infrastructure," Armato chief executive Mark Froman said.
